intro: Pulsatilla turczaninovii f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered pasqueflower, is a rare and striking plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine regions, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Its foliage consists of palmately divided leaves that are often hairy and dark green. This frost-sensitive species is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of Central Asia.
